title: Downing Street in bullish mood before crucial Brexit vote as source insists: 'We will not be asking for a delay'
text:
Having returned victorious from Brussels with the ‘unicorn’ Brexit deal critics had insisted could never been renegotiated with the EU, it is little wonder Boris Johnson’s Downing Street is in bullish mood right now.

Despite facing an uphill battle to win Saturday's meaningful vote in the face of yet another slew of unhelpful amendments, Number 10’s mantra remains unchanged since Dominic Cummings declared 80 days ago that there was ‘nothing MPs can do’ to stop Brexit - deal or no deal.

Team Johnson appears not only to have been emboldened by the Prime Minister’s bravura performance across the Channel but also the fact that the EU has helped the government’s case by appearing to rule out Article...
description: Having returned victorious from Brussels with the ‘unicorn’ Brexit deal critics had insisted could never been renegotiated with the EU, it is little wonder Boris Johnson’s Downing Street is in bullish mood right now.
